column5: great news
This is good news. Listen to the others about following orders to the letter. I know you'll be fine and this'll have been just a bump in the road for you. You'll be fishing soon. Be well.

Thanks everyone. This is actually my 3rd heart operation and by far I am in the worst pain of them well atleast the last one wasnt as painfull. The first one I was 3 weeks old. Now I have to really watch though as last night the wife started to get really sick with the flu so lets hope I dont get that. Thanks again I appreciate the thoughts. Its like a big family this forum.
Great to hear the surgery went well. Now for the recovery. You'll be on the water in no time.

Just to keep you guys up dated I am back in the hospital I was feeling pretty rough tonight so I came in. Probably a good thing to it looks like I have some fluid around my heart . Looks like I may be taking a bit longer to recover then I was even hoping. Lets hope that this isnt the case.
All in good time Chris.
Just talked to the doc again and looks like I may be here awhile. The one upside is the Doctor is very attractive.
That will help your heart. Mind over body

Thanks Chris. You are 100% there mind over matter is one of the biggest things. This days not getting any better though now they think I may have a virus that is resistent to anti-biotics lol. Said I may have gotten it from the other day here as there was an outbreak. The only thing going for me is I don't have a fever I have the symptoms and have had them since I left. Oh well just one more small bump. Just got look at it that there are people in alot worst cases.

That's always the case. My dad passed away a couple years ago but not from what he went in the hospital for but what he got while he was there. Take care of yourself Chris and you should be fine. Your young and strong with a good will to push forward.

Thanks Chris. Sorry to hear about your dad as well. I am fortunate that I am young  and in good health minus a few heart problems. The sad thing is that most of these outbreaks are do to a nurse or doctor not washing. On the other hand I would have most likely died at 3 weeks old if it weren't for the doctors. I am really sorry to hear of your father.

Good morning Chris Hospitals can be a double edged sword. Even when my dad was there we would have to put on aprons and gloves and sanitize our hands every time we left and re-entered the room and still it wasn't enough. Life is a gamble at best and the guarantee's are limited... That's why we should take every day as a blessing and never take our health for granted.

Yea you are right. Life isn't always fair you just have to make what you can of it. For years I was able to play hockey, rugby all the sports like that and well when I was diagnosed with this second heart problem that stuff came to a stop. I am lucky to still do the sports I do and I dont think I will stop till I am told. I was also a moron and smoked for about 8 years and I finally quit that 3 months ago. As for the gloves and aprons I am in that case right now. All I have to say is I hope my wife thats 8 months pregnant doesnt get this virus.

Well I just thought I would let you folks know that my heart surgery went good from what the Doctors said. Looks like I wob't be able to fish or  do anything for some time.  Hope every one had a good holiday and have a happy nre year.
Great news & thanks for the update !!
Glad to here the good news ! By spring you should be ready to go
Great new Chris! thanks for letting us know. May as well take it easy and relax for a bit - when that new baby arrives the opportunties for R&R will be significantly reduced.

Thanks Lew, Chris and Rick. Rick your right about that the baby is going to be here soon. I just hope that I am recovered and able to get a job. The compnay I was working for laid off a bunch of people so it doesn't look like I will be going back there.  As for the fishing I hope to get out alot earlier then spring. I wont be able to go to the niagara for some steelhead but I think ice fishing will be very do-able. That is if we get any ice this year around here.
I wouldn't even consider fishing for steel until your 100%...Too much adrenaline involved Sounds like your going to have your hands full soon enough anyways !! Congrads on your upcoming edition
A Good Year ahead. Happy to hear all went well.
Good News Chris Here's to a great 2012 for you.  Paul
Thanks all. I will have my hands full thats forsure. The good thing is my daughter is just learning how to actually fish so hopefully by the summer her and I can get out together for some fishing.
Great News---Stay Well---
Great to hear.  You'll be in great shape and all ready for soft-water.
Glad to hear Chris, youll be out fishing in no time. Concentrate on yourself and the arrival of a new born.
That's good news. Your board name says it all. You'll be up and at it in no time. See you on the water.
That's great news, and you'll be out there in no time at all.  Here's to a happy, healthy new year
Thanks all. I hope to be out there soon and posting a better report then this.
I'm glad to hear the news Chris   and don't worry about the reports... you get well first
Glad to hear that surgery went well. Take care of yourself!
Thanks everyone.
speedy recovery
Good excuse to get a gas auger dontcha think ? Hope the post op recovery goes smoothly and your ticker is 110% when season opener hits next spring !
I was thinking either a gas auger or a good friend lol. As for being a 110% I hope so as well seeing as I am going for a week long musky trip for the opener.
Glad to hear they were able to put a new spring in the old ticker. Follow the Doc's orders and you will be fishing in no time.   Art
Thanks Art. When it comes to my heart I always listen to the doctors.
Glad to hear it all went well Chris.
Glad to hear, its always nice to have some positive news, best wishes on your compolete recovery
